section.title: net-start
section.para: Starts an inactive, previously defined, virtual network.

entry.para: The name or UUID of the virtual network to start.

example.para: Starts the virtual network that has a UUID of "b7005dec-be1a-fe9a-338a-0cb1301dfcfd".

listitem.para: Starting with an XML file we've already created, using the required XML format:
We start virsh interactively, then define a persistent virtual network using the XML file:
listitem.screen:
# virsh Welcome to virsh, the virtualization interactive terminal.
Type: 'help' for help with commands 'quit' to quit
virsh # net-list Name State Autostart ----------------------------------------- default active yes
virsh # net-define /root/examplenetwork.xml Network examplenetwork defined from /root/examplenetwork.xml
virsh # net-list --all Name State Autostart ----------------------------------------- default active yes examplenetwork inactive no <-- new persistent networks start out inactive
listitem.para: Newly defined virtual networks aren't automatically started, so we manually start it now:
listitem.screen: virsh # net-start examplenetwork <-- this is net-start in action Network examplenetwork started
virsh # net-list Name State Autostart ----------------------------------------- default active yes examplenetwork active no <-- the persistent network is now running (active)
listitem.para: We check the details of the started network from virsh, using . This shows us the name of the bridge network interface.
listitem.screen: virsh # net-dumpxml examplenetwork <network> <name>examplenetwork</name> <uuid>b7005dec-be1a-fe9a-338a-0cb1301dfcfd</uuid> <forward mode='route'/> <bridge name='virbr100' stp='on' delay='0' /> <-- the "virbr100" here <ip address='10.10.120.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'> </ip> </network>
listitem.para: If the virtualisation server is running Linux, we can check how the bridge interface appears to the host OS:
listitem.screen: # ifconfig virbr100 virbr100 Link encap:Ethernet HWaddr A6:45:97:AE:8E:08 inet addr:10.10.120.1 Bcast:10.10.120.255 Mask:255.255.255.0 UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST MTU:1500 Metric:1 RX packets:0 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0 TX packets:11 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0 collisions:0 txqueuelen:0 RX bytes:0 (0.0 b) TX bytes:2653 (2.5 KiB)
